lung_cancer.models.tensorflow.layers module¶

Helper functions for creating layers written on tensorflow.

lung_cancer.models.tensorflow.layers.bn_conv3d(input_tensor, filters, kernel_size, name, strides=(1, 1, 1), padding='same', activation=<function relu>, use_bias=False, is_training=True)[source]¶

Apply 3D convolution operation with batch normalization to input tensor.

Parameters:
  • input_tensor (tf.Tensor) – input tensor for 3D-convolution.
  • filters (int) – number of filters in the ouput tensor.
  • kernel_size (tuple(int, int, int)) – size of kernel for 3D-convolution operation along 3 dimensions.
  • name (str) – name of the layer that will be used as an argument of tf.variable_scope.
  • strides (tuple(int, int, int)) – size of strides along 3 dimensions required by tf.layers.conv3d.
  • padding (str) – padding mode, can be ‘same’ or ‘valid’.
  • activation (tensorflow activation function) – this function will be applied to output tensor.
  • use_bias (bool) – whether use bias or not.
  • is_training (tf.Tensor or bool) – whether model is in training state of prediction state.
Returns:

output tensor.
Return type:

tf.Tensor
lung_cancer.models.tensorflow.layers.bn_dilated_conv3d(input_tensor, filters, kernel_size, name, activation=<function relu>, dilation=(1, 1, 1), padding='same', is_training=True)[source]¶

Apply 3D-dilated-convolution operation with batch normalization to input tensor.

Parameters:
  • input_tensor (tf.Tensor) – input tensor for 3D-convolution.
  • filters (int) – number of filters in the ouput tensor.
  • kernel_size (tuple(int, int, int)) – size of kernel for 3D-convolution operation along 3 dimensions.
  • name (str) – name of the layer that will be used as an argument of tf.variable_scope.
  • dilation (tuple(int, int, int)) – dilation rate along 3 dimensions.
  • strides (tuple(int, int, int)) – size of strides along 3 dimensions required by tf.layers.conv3d.
  • padding (str) – padding mode, can be ‘same’ or ‘valid’.
  • activation (tensorflow activation function) – this function will be applied to output tensor.
  • use_bias (bool) – whether use bias or not.
  • is_training (tf.Tensor or bool) – whether model is in training state of prediction state.
Returns:

output tensor.
Return type:

tf.Tensor

lung_cancer.models.tensorflow.losses module¶

Contains losses used in tensorflow models.

lung_cancer.models.tensorflow.losses.dice_loss(y_true, y_pred, smooth=1e-07)[source]¶

Loss function base on dice coefficient.

Parameters:
  • y_true (tf.Tensor) – tensor containing target mask.
  • y_pred (tf.Tensor) – tensor containing predicted mask.
  • smooth (float) – small real value used for avoiding division by zero error.
Returns:

tensor containing tiversky loss.
Return type:

tf.Tensor
lung_cancer.models.tensorflow.losses.iou_3d(y_true, y_pred, epsilon=1e-06)[source]¶

Compute intersection over union in 3D case for input tensors.

Parameters:
  • y_true (tf.Tensor) – tensor containg true values for sizes of nodules and their centers.
  • y_pred (tf.Tensor) – tensor containing predicted values for sizes of nodules and their centers.
  • epsilon (float) – small real value used for avoiding division by zero error.
Returns:

tensor containing intersection over union computed on input tensors.
Return type:

tf.Tensor

  • y_pred (tf.Tensor) – tensor containing predicted mask.
  • smooth (float) – small real value used for avoiding division by zero error.
Returns:

tensor containing negative logarithm of jaccard coefficient.

lung_cancer.models.tensorflow.losses.log_loss(y_true, y_pred, epsilon=1e-06)[source]¶

Log loss on input tensors.

Parameters:
  • y_true (tf.Tensor) – tensor with true labels.
  • y_pred (tf.Tensor) – tensor with predicted logits;
  • epsilon (float or tf.constant(dtype=tf.float32)) – small real value to avoid computing log(0).
Returns:

log loss on input tensors.
Return type:

tf.Tensor
lung_cancer.models.tensorflow.losses.reg_l2_loss(y_true, y_pred, lambda_coords=0.75)[source]¶

L2 loss for prediction of cancer tumor’s centers, sizes joined with binary classification task.

Parameters:
  • y_true (-) – tensor containing true values for sizes of nodules, their centers and classes of crop(1 if cancerous 0 otherwise).
  • y_pred (-) – tensor containing predicted values for sizes of nodules, their centers and probability of cancer in given crop.
Returns:

l2 loss for regression of cancer tumor center’s coordinates, sizes joined with binary classification task.
Return type:

tf.Tensor

Note

y_true and y_pred tensors must have [None, 7] shapes; y_true[:, :3] and y_pred[:, :3] correspond to normalized (from [0, 1] interval) zyx coordinates of cancer tumor, while y_true[:, 3:6] and y_pred[:, 3:6] correspond to sizes of cancer tumor along zyx axes(also normalized), finally, y_true[:, 6] and y_pred[:, 6] represent whether cancer tumor presents or not in the current crop.

lung_cancer.models.tensorflow.losses.tiversky_loss(y_true, y_pred, alpha=0.3, beta=0.7, smooth=1e-10)[source]¶

Tiversky loss function.

Parameters:
  • y_true (tf.Tensor) – tensor containing target mask.
  • y_pred (tf.Tensor) – tensor containing predicted mask.
  • alpha (float) – real value, weight of ‘0’ class.
  • beta (float) – real value, weight of ‘1’ class.
  • smooth (float) – small real value used for avoiding division by zero error.
Returns:

tensor containing tiversky loss.
Return type:

tf.Tensor

lung_cancer.models.tensorflow.tf_model module¶

Contains base class for all tensorflow models.

class lung_cancer.models.tensorflow.tf_model.TFModelCT(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: lung_cancer.dataset.dataset.models.tf.tf_model.TFModel

Base class for all tensorflow models.

This class inherits TFModel class from dataset submodule and extends it with metrics accumulating methods. Also train and predict methods were overloaded: train method gets ‘x’ and ‘y’, while predict gets only ‘x’ as arguments instead of ‘feed_dict’ and ‘fetches’ as it was in parent class. It’s simplifies interface and makes TFModel3D compatible with KerasModel interface.

Methods

predict(x=None, fetches=None)[source]¶

Predict model on data provided.

Parameters:
  • x (ndarray(batch_size, ...)) – numpy array that will be fed into tf.placeholder that can be accessed by ‘x’ attribute of ‘self’, typically input of neural network.
  • fetches (list or tuple) – `tf.Operation`s and `tf.Tensor`s to calculate.
Returns:

predicted output.
Return type:

ndarray(batch_size, ..)
train(x=None, y=None, fetches=None)[source]¶

Train model with data provided.

Parameters:
  • x (ndarray(batch_size, ..)) – numpy array that will be fed into tf.placeholder that can be accessed by ‘x’ attribute of ‘self’, typically input of neural network.
  • y (ndarray(batch_size, ..)) – numpy array that will be fed into tf.placeholder that can be accessed by ‘y’ attribute of ‘self’.
  • fetches (list or tuple) – `tf.Operation`s and `tf.Tensor`s to calculate.
Returns:

predicted output.
Return type:

ndarray(batch_size, ..)

Module contents¶

Contains losses, useful utils specific for tensorflow and implementation of ANN architectures.
